abstract: A former stock loan trader at Morgan Stanley and Bank of America in New York received well over $100,000 of cash kickbacks by steering orders to other brokerage firms, the Securities and Exchange Commission said in a lawsuit filed Tuesday.
snippet: A former stock loan trader at Morgan Stanley and Bank of America in New York received well over $100,000 of cash kickbacks by steering orders to other brokerage firms, the Securities and Exchange Commission said in a lawsuit filed Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: A former stock loan trader at Morgan Stanley and Bank of America in New York received well over $100,000 of cash kickbacks by steering orders to other brokerage firms, the Securities and Exchange Commission said in a lawsuit filed on Tuesday, Reuters reports.

headline.main: S.E.C. Accuses Ex-Trader of Taking Kickbacks

abstract: The decision that could cost the bank tens of millions a year and put pressure on other banks to do the same.
snippet: The decision that could cost the bank tens of millions a year and put pressure on other banks to do the same.
lead_paragraph: In a move that could bring an end to the $40 cup of coffee, Bank of America said on Tuesday that it was doing away with overdraft fees on purchases made with debit cards, a decision that could cost the bank tens of millions a year in revenue and put pressure on other banks to do the same.

headline.main: Bank of America to End Debit Overdraft Fees
headline.print_headline: Bank of America to End Debit Overdraft Fees
